Frankly, we can't say for sure whether it will get an official unveiling of any kind but in the meantime we have heard that it is already gearing up to make its way to Europe. All of this is housed inside a 171.7 x 77.8 x 8.26mm, 193g body. The phone boots Android 15 Go edition. We aren't sure if a charger is included in this price. The Bangladesh units seem to come with a 15W charger. Source

The Xiaomi Redmi A5 4G is currently in a rather weird spot. Technically, it hasn't been formally announced yet, but it is already selling in stores in Bangladesh. Frankly, we can't say for sure whether it will get an official unveiling of any kind but in the meantime we have heard that it is already gearing up to make its way to Europe. This could be under the Poco C71 moniker, but regardless, it seems to be the same hardware.


Xiaomi Redmi A5 colors

Some specs "highlights" include a 6.88-inch, 120Hz, 720p+ LCD rated for 1,500 nits of brightness, a Unisoc T7250 chipset alongside LPDDR4X RAM and eMMC 5.1 storage. In Bangladesh, the phone comes in two configurations - 4/64GB for BDT 11,000 and 6/128GB for BDT 13,000.

Other specs include a 32MP main camera and an 8MP selfie. There is also a 5,200 mAh battery on board, with support for 18W charging. The Redmi A5 4G also has a side-mounted fingerprint reader, Bluetooth 5.2, a Type-C port and a 3.5mm audio jack, plus a microSD expansion slot. All of this is housed inside a 171.7 x 77.8 x 8.26mm, 193g body. The phone boots Android 15 Go edition.


Xiaomi Redmi A5

As per the source, the European market might just get a storage tier that is unlike the ones we already mentioned – 4GB, plus 128GB for €149. We aren't sure if a charger is included in this price. The Bangladesh units seem to come with a 15W charger.
